title.narrative: MW-0000150 YFHS in Malawi

description.narrative:
let op dit project moet mee in de migratie, openstaande bedrag mag in 2019 vrijvallen GKN 20190305
Youth friendly health services in Malawi: Reducing new STI and HIV infections and teenage pregnancies amongst young people in 2 districts in Southern Malawi. • Effective linkages and referral systems established between schools and health facilities in 12 selected communities in Mangochi and Chikwawa. - Objective: a) increase in uptake of YFHS, specifically STI/HIV testing and contraceptive use; and b) improved girls empowerment to take own decisions regarding SRH.
-1800 young people between 10-15 years old (standard 7-8) in 12 primary schools in 2 districts are able to make healthy and informed choices regarding their sexual and reproductive health. - 3600 young people between 10 and 24 years old make use of the youth friendly health services in Chikwawa and Mangochi district. - Health care services and 40 staff of health centres are youth-friendly and provide care that suit the needs of young people in a non-judgmental way. - 24 Teachers in schools and 36 peer educators in youth clubs are equipped to deliver comprehensive sexuality education.

title.narrative: MW-0000172 Starschool Progr. 2016-2019

description.narrative: Het STER-school programma heeft een eerste pilotfase gekend van 2013-2015 in 7 scholen. Tijdens deze tweede fase willen we het programma opschalen naar 18 scholen in de 3 regio’s. Hiermee worden 20.000 kinderen, 280 leraren, en 520 leden van ouderraden en moedergroepen bereikt. Daarnaast bereiken we ook indirect de traditionele en religieuze gemeenschapsleiders, de lokale overheid, en het Ministerie van Onderwijs op lokaal, regionaal en nationaal niveau. voor 2017 nog verdere opschaling naar 30 scholen in 4 regio's. 27000 leerlingen 90 leraren 159 head teachers en 900 leden van smc pta en moedergroepen betrokken.

title.narrative: KE-0000156 SBNN STER-school West-Kenia

description.narrative: STER-school programma op 28 scholen in West-Nyakach, Kenia. Zie projectplan basic en considerations in projectmap. In 2016 uitvoerige baselinestudy uitgevoerd

title.narrative: ET-0000165 STAR-school program in Ethiopia

description.narrative: The general objective of star-school program is to improve students’ academic achievement in 42 primary schools through school improvement program. Specific objectives: 1. Infrastructure/school environment: To make 42 primary schools child friendly and conducive for learning in the next three years. 2. Teaching: To capacitate 412 teachers to effectively use active learning methods in their classroom. 3. Learning: To improve the average learning results of 67.658 students from the existing 53% to 76% in the coming three years. 4. School-management: To capacitate 294 members of school management team to enable them provide effective support for the school improvement program. 5. Community involvement: To Mobilize the local community to support schools and contribute for the school development programs. This project is designed to benefit 67,658 primary school students (34,288 directly and 33,370 indirectly-with 50% female) in 42 rural primary schools located in three National Regional States of the country: Afar, Amhara, Oromia and Addis Ababa City Administration. The project will be implemented in cluster form in which 18 primary schools are directly addressed. These 18 cluster schools will share lessons with the rest 24 Satellite schools in which 2-3 primary schools are clustered under a target school. The selection has been made on the bases of the intensity of their poverty status and level of marginalization for quality education.

title.narrative: MW-0000295 Improvement of Voc. Centre EVTI

description.narrative: Zie info op de W schijf digitalize the TEVT offer of EVTI improve college environment of EVTI link EVTI to the labour markte 7 steps

transaction.ref: MW-0000295 Improvement of Voc. Centre EVTI

title.narrative: KE-0000302 Youth@Work 2017

description.narrative: First, it provides the marginalised youth the tools they need for self-support. The ultimate goal (1) is they have a substantial and sustainable income and are food secure for themselves and the children in their care. To achieve this long term goal, the project focusses on the whole chain from attitude change, access to quality vocational training to industrial exposure and accessing the job market, while generating regular feed back on the training method and organizing refresher courses by Kenyan's Premier Hospitality and Tourism Training School. The second goal is that Ujima, through its income generating programs endeavors to become self-sustaining, and therefore donor independent in the future. • 240 orphaned heads (146 female and 94 male) of households taking care of at least three siblings, access vocational education in tourism and hospitality in Kisumu and Nakuru per year. • 95% of the trainees complete the orientation program and the skill centre (industrial attachment) successfully and 80 percent of them have gainful employment by the end of 2017. • Improved curricular for entrepreneurship and ICT training alongside the Employability training to assure its continued relevance to the labour market. • Inclusion of Sexual and reproductive health within our training model by the end of 2017 to address among other issues the drop out cases. • Improved collaboration with the line Ministries in view of ensuring proper standards are adhered. • Hotel classification to international and national standards (Maili Saba Camp in Nakuru). • The income towards the training program is increased with 5% per year. 240 orphaned heads (146 female and 94 male) of households taking care of at least three siblings Indirect: 729 sibblings

participating-org.ref: Ujima Foundation for Training and Development - UFTD

title.narrative: GH-0000439 CSE in Starschools 2019-2021

description.narrative: The proposed approach is to continue to work with the existing Star schools to consolidate the gains made and also to select 5 new schools in the Volta region to work in the third year. Some schools need to be replaced due to the lukewarm attitude of facilitators while the number of club members in very large schools will be increased. There will be three sets of trainings. The first will be a refresher for existing CSE facilitators and peer educators, the second will target new teachers and the third will be for both the existing and new facilitators which will be a review meeting to discuss challenges and strengths. We will work together with GES to select suitable teachers who are willing and ready to be trained as facilitators to ensure commitment. Head teachers will be key in ensuring the success of the project in their schools. They will be part of the stakeholder consultation processes and will be tasked to assist facilitators to come out with weekly time schedules for lessons. This will address the challenges associated with the allocation of periods for the club meetings.

title.narrative: SR-0000416 Vernieuwing ond./kinderbegeleid. 2018

description.narrative: Duurzame kwaliteitsverbetering basisonderwijs (competente leerkrachten, kindvriendelijk en effectief lesgeven, hogere slagingspercentages) en grotere betrokkenheid van ouders en gemeenschappen. - 7300 leerlingen profiteren van een modern onderwijssysteem met disciplines als: thematisch werken, coöperatieve werkvormen, verlengde instructie, zone van de naaste ontwikkeling en op 25 geselecteerde basisscholen in de districten Brokopondo, Wanica, Para, Saramacca en Coronie en Saramacca. - 270 leerkrachten passen training in effectief leren en kindvriendelijke pedagogiek toe. Hebben goede relaties met ouders en gemeenschap. - 150 leerkrachten getraind als sociaal maatschappelijk werker die goede relaties met ouders onderhouden en kinderen effectief begeleiden (o.a. oplossen gedragsproblemen). - Capaciteit van Openbare scholen en overheid versterkt - Grote afname van (huiselijk) geweld tegen kinderen. Ouders participeren daadwerkelijk in schoolzaken.

title.narrative: KE-0000196 From SASH to STAR 31 primary schools

description.narrative: With this proposed 3 years program, Pamoja Child Foundation will build upon the foundation laid through her SASH project, by enabling 31 primary schools it worked with, to become role models/STAR schools as an approach to quality improvement for basic education in Kisumu county. This will yield best results from investments made. So far, SASH project through its interventions has enabled the 31 primary schools to achieve: 1. Increased pupils enrolments 2. Improved academic performance 3. Reduced cases of school drop outs & cases of early pregnancies From SASH to STAR School project is an initiative being implemented by Pamoja Child Foundation in Awasi & Nyang’oma location of Kisumu County. The project target 31 public primary schools with an approximate population of 10,500 pupils, 310 teachers, 310 BOMs and 3,500 parents and guardians.

transaction.ref: KE-0000196 From SASH to STAR 31 primary schools

title.narrative: SS-0000198 Vocational skills development ...

description.narrative:
Access to vocational skills development and income generating opportunities for vulnerable youth through capacity development and direct service provision by CSOs and LAs in Western Bahr el Ghazal and Warrap State. Doel Kansarme jongeren in de leeftijd van 15-35 jaar via een goede beroepsopleiding aan werk helpen waardoor ze in hun eigen onderhoud en dat van hun families kunnen voorzien.
Doelgroep Het project richt zich op: • 4800 jongeren in de leeftijd van 15-35 jaar: 3564 jongeren die hun basisschool niet afgemaakt hebben, 365 vluchtelingen/jongeren die terugkeren na de burgeroorlog, 410 gehandicapten, 210 jonge moeders (overlap tussen de groepen) • 7 beroepsopleidingen in Wau en Kuajok en Akon North (Zuid Soedan regio Warrap en regio Western Bahr el Ghazal) • Lokale en regionale overheden
Doelstellingen: • Verbeterde toegang tot 7 beroepsopleidingen voor kansarme jongeren • Verbeterde match van de 7 beroepsopleidingen met de behoefte op de lokale arbeidsmarkt. • Verbeterde kwaliteit van het onderwijs op 7 beroepsopleidingen • Via 2 arbeidsbureaus worden getrainde jongeren aan werk geholpen
Beoogde resultaten • De toegang tot beroepsonderwijs wordt met 70% verhoogd. In 2020 hebben 4800 jongeren een beroepsopleiding gevolgd. • De kwaliteit van het beroepsonderwijs op 7 beroepsopleidingen wordt verbeterd • 2.600 mannen en vrouwen hebben in 2020 werk gevonden.

title.narrative: IN-0000199 Sterschool Boudh District

description.narrative:

Project will be implemented in 50 government primary and upper primary schools of Boudh block of Boudh districts, Odisha.
Due to higher fundraising and extra initiatives on training CSE and STAR-BEQUIP budget 2017 is topped up with € 8.578 to 50K

sector.narrative: Basic life skills for youth and adults

title.narrative: UG-0000206 Skilling Youth Empl. Agribus. (SKY)

description.narrative:
The Skilling Youth for Employment in Agribusinesses SKY is a five year programme which builds on the legacy of previous programmes in Uganda funded both by the Netherlands Embassy and other donors: the challenges, gaps and successes identified in the implementation. One of the main gaps identified during is the involvement of the private sector in offering skills in Uganda, which is paramount but necessitates a paradigm mind shift in Business Technical and Vocational Education Training (BTVET) programming. Actors still believe that skilling is only formal and only through the BTVETs which are mandated to deliver them. Nevertheless, key lessons learnt demonstrate that it is possible to establish a mechanism for private sector participation in skills provision at farmer level and BTVET setting. Private Public Partnerships (PPPs) are essential to promote relevance of BTVET trainings through apprenticeship/on-the-job-training programs. SKY strategically looks at such partnerships in order to improve access, quality and relevance of skilling youths, women and farmers to be better agripreneurs and create employment by equipping men and women with market driven skills in agriculture, agribusinesses and support services. The project is proposed to cover five (5) regions namely: Lango, Lake Kyoga Area, Elgon Area, Lake Victoria Crescent and Western Uganda. The targets are: BTVET institutions, Agriculture Colleges, the Private Sector, Youths, Farmers and Women.
Edukans role will focus on capacity building of BTVET institutions, and linking these institutions with the private sector. Edukans will do so using proven methods and approaches.

title.narrative: ET-0000210 Textile Project Ethiopia

description.narrative:
General objective: Contribute to employment opportunity and business development in the textile industry in Bahir Dar City Administration.
Specific objectives: 1. 120 young people employed in the textile sector, of which 90 are self-employed and 30 are employed in the existing textile industry 2. A new business model in the textile industry is tested and documented for scaling up 3. Innovative Training and Production Centre established, based on a long-term sustainable business strategy 4. DEC and stakeholders capacity developed on designing, developing and delivering demand-driven skills training Direct Beneficiaries of the program include: 120 unemployed youth (equal gender balance)
Indirect Beneficiaries of the program include: 720 family members of the youth 7,500 community, government stakeholders and training institutions 12 DEC staff members

PI tender juli 2016. Zie W-schijf voor meer informatie.
Realize high quality social and financial education to form part of the regular education program of 40 rural public primary schools in three of Peru´s poorest regions. As a result, more than 3,200 children will be developing new skills and have more self-esteem, making them less vulnerable and more prepared for the future, allowing them to have better opportunities.
Contract was 179.814 maar eigen lokale bijdrage was meegeteld. Dat tellen wij niet mee. Nu doen we 50/50 en wordt het totale contractbedrag naar beneden bijgesteld. (7/11/2017)

title.narrative: PE-0000229 STAR-school in Iquitos

description.narrative:
PI tender juli 2016. Zie W-schijf voor meer informatie. Improvement of the accessibility & quality of education School: Sarita Colonia school in Sarita Colonia 1000 children, 50 teachers, parents STAR - escuela 1: Reducción de la pobreza (siguiendo el modelo de STAR-escuela) 1. Birth certificates for approximately 1000 children. 2. Development of state school into a STAR school: help 150-200 children with better education and 6 teachers with better skills. 3. Training of 25-50 teachers in dynamics, fun math and technical reading. 4. Help 40-60 children with significant educational deficits at preschool. 5. All children involved in one of our programs, their parents and their teachers benefit from our early stimulation program. 2: Desarrollo capacidades School boards trained on management of schools 3: Cabildeo y soporte activo Relations established with DRE, Reniec, Vaso de Leche, SIS. Campaigning via Radio & TV, local authorities
STAR-escuela: Percentage rise in completion rate. Percentage improvement of learning results Dropout rate (%)

title.narrative: ML-0000243 Dev new type region oriented educ

description.narrative:
The Lycée Professionnel is a public professional school, open to all students who have qualified for secondary technical education. Students will be mainly Dogon and Peul who inhabit the Dogon region.
When the Lycée Professionel starts in October 2016, there is a capacity of 150 students. When the school is completed in 2018 it may accommodate 400 to 600 students. They all may profit of the adapted curriculum, traineeships and the course in entrepreneurship.
As in the program ‘les mots Imprimés’ the teachers will become more motivated and enthusiastic by training and that will create a good atmosphere in the school. A good school can compete with the regular education in the city (Mopti, Bamako).
The inhabitants of the Dogon region may profit from an secondary education in Sangha. Families will not be split up and more experts on issues relevant for the region are available. Moreover, the intention is that experts will create businesses and will thus stimulate the local employment and economy.

transaction.ref: ML-0000243 Dev new type region oriented educ

title.narrative: GH-0000244 Improve Literacy Levels Bolgatanga

description.narrative:
PI tender juli 2016 zie W schijf voor meer informatie Improve literacy levels Ghanaian children by providing the school libraries with books for a period of three years and by giving the teachers of the same schools training. One of the libraries will be an example library which can be used for training (library skills) purposes as well
20 schools, 40 teachers, 6566 students.
1: Poverty reduction (following STAR-school model) • In 2019, 20 schools have received at least 865 books for the school library.
• In 2019, the literacy levels of 600 pupils are assessed based on the methodology that the partner chooses to be the best suited to show the impact the project wants to reach (this can be the EGRA methodology or another evaluation method).
2: Capacity building • In 2019, 40 teachers will have the knowledge they need in order to run the school library successfully and know how to inspire the children to read. • The education officer of CESRUD and one member of Biblionef Ghana will be present during the workshop. 3. Lobby and advocacy Biblionef together with CESRUD will visit the Regional Education office in Bolgatanga to discuss ways the project can be supported and sustained To create visibility for the project, the books will be handed over to the schools at a handing over ceremony with local authority presence.

title.narrative: SN-0000263 STARS

description.narrative:
MasterCard Foundation is funding this large scale project to ICCO Terrafina. In the ICCO Terrafina/MasterCard Foundation project, Edukans’ activities will be focused on Senegal and target the selected value chains (onion and black-eyed peas). Depending on the availability of existing curricula (e.g. from government, training providers), Edukans will contribute to relevant curricula. Relevant means adjusted to the needs of the farmers (and the demands of the buyers of produce) and current competences. Edukans skills experts will train the training (BDS) providers in the following activities:
• Rapid assessment farmers and market (e.g. buyers) • Rapid assessment available training in surroundings • Develop /adjust (basic) qualification framework for onion and black-eyed peas • Develop / adjust curricula • Assess capacities of trainers and if needed, provide training (could be didactical and/or technical competences) • Include track and tracing of trained farmers in M&E of total programme • Create sustainable institutional linkages between providers, market and formerly trained farmers.
Projectperiode verlengd tot eind december 2018

transaction.ref: ET-0000266 Early Childhood Care and Dev.

title.narrative: GH-0000267 NICHE II-Sexual Health TVET trainees

description.narrative:
Strengthen post-secondary TVET providers in the field of SRHR education to increase effectiveness of their vocational training courses, especially for girls and women.
NICHE EP Nuffic 154.288 is de grant; total budget is 190.590; Eigen bijdrage Edukans is 29.434 Eigen bijdrage Rutgers is 3.098 en Eigen bijdrage Savsign is 3770 in total zijn de Eigen bijdragen 36.303 99.929 contract savsign dat is inclusief bijdrage in kind van 3.770 overgemaakt naar de partner en dus gereserveerd zal worden 96.159 13610,50 contract Rutgers inclusief eigen bijdrage van 3098 gereserveerd om over te maken wordt 10512,50 Totale eigen bijdrage van Edukans wordt als unbillable gereserveerd. wat met de rest van de grant is dat voor Edukans?
14 Programme officers and curriculum developers within 7 (non-formal) post-secondary TVET training providers in Ghana. Our innovative initiative is two-folded and will result in 2 major outcomes: - Outcome 1: Post-secondary TVET providers are able to identify the SRHR needs of their target group, and respond to this within their own organisations. - Outcome 2: Post-secondary TVET providers offer CSE for their students, with a curriculum that fits the specific needs of their target group and is adapted to the local context. To achieve these outcome results, we have carefully planned activities that will lead to the following results at output level: - Output 1.1. 14 staff members of 7 post-secondary TVET providers are trained in research methodologies to develop a comprehensive SRHR policy for their organisations. - Output 2.1. 14 staff members of 7 post-secondary TVET providers are trained in the design and development of a comprehensive sexuality education curriculum for young people in post-secondary TVET programmes. Output 2.2. Based on the results and lessons learnt of a small-scale pilot in 7 post-secondary TVET institutions, the working group adapted the CSE curriculum for final approval by the advisory board.

transaction.ref: GH-0000267 NICHE II-Sexual Health TVET trainees

title.narrative: ET-0000380 Early Childcare Development

description.narrative:
This project secures Early Child Care and Development opportunity for schools, parents and children of 3 age to primary level through playing and learning materials supply made from locally available resources. These materials, which are going to be produced from local available resources, will have two major pluses for the schools and children. The first one is that the target groups will have the materials so that the quality of education in general and teaching & learning processes in particular will be advanced. More specifically children’s skills and wellbeing status will be improved. The second advantage of the project is to be sources of income for the DEC/Edukans. The production centre will produce the items from locally available materials and the product will be sold to vulnerable schools with rational profit.
amount falls on budget 2017

title.narrative: IN-0000385 CSE India - Mo Katha Mo Kahani

description.narrative:
Product development Comprehensive Sexuality Education Curriculum in Boudh district India
The MKMH curriculum will be developed for use in Odisha, and piloted in 8 upper primary schools with class 6-8 learners (aged 11-14 years.) Ensure access to relevant quality comprehensive sexual education to 1000 adolescents between the age group of 9 to 15 years in 8 Primary and upper primary schools of Boudh district of Odisha between the period November 2017 to March 2019.

transaction.ref: IN-0000385 CSE India - Mo Katha Mo Kahani

title.narrative: ET-0000386 CSE Ethiopia Meharebe Aysaita

description.narrative:
This project contributes towards positive behavioural development and healthy decision making of adolescent and young people on their SRHR. The project targets three primary schools, one in the Aysaita Refugee Camp and two in the Aysaita woreda, which is referred as the Host Community. The target beneficiaries ranges from young people, school community (teachers, PTA members, school management), community members (including parents, religious and clan leaders), key stakeholders at the woreda offices and regional level bureaus.
The target beneficiaries highly lack adolescent and youth SRHR interventions; and are prone to experiencing major challenges that contradict with developmental aspects of physical, emotional/psychological, sexual, and societal developments; which in turn influence their positive development and overall wellbeing.
The project will focus on the following areas: Improved utilization of comprehensive SRH information and education by young people. Improved conducive and enabling environment at the school and community level.
Some of the activities are: awareness raising and Sensitization Workshops; contextualization of the existing CSE manuals and capacity enhancement.
Hours Herman

MM-0000358 Educ. Needs Assessment Myanmar

description.narrative:
From the LWF/Edukans Education Needs Assessment carried out in Rakhine State in July 2017, it was learned that access to education is only effective if education programmes offer good learning opportunities. This means an education that children understand, which is relevant to their learning needs. It was noted in the assessment that the quality of education the formal schools is on average “moderate”, while the overall teaching-learning process in the IDP camps is classified as “weak”. It was recommended to provide continuous training to teachers in child-centred pedagogy and participatory teaching and learning methodologies to increase the academic learning outcomes of students, as well as their social-emotional skills.
The purpose of the training ToT conducted by Edukans is to improve the uptake and impact of pedagogy among government formal teachers, IDP teachers in LWF’s Education programming. Staff from national and international NGOs, and supervisors (government officials) are trained to guide and support teachers on how to apply the Active Learning method in their daily classroom practice in order to enhance learning and critical thinking for lifelong learning.

title.narrative: LB-0000365 True Vine Education Project

description.narrative: 550 Syrian refugee children in 3 education centers in Lebanon maintain their studies and do not fall out of the educational system. They receive quality education and psychoscial support in a safe environment. Main activities in Zahlé. 80 teachers (2000 children) participate in the Education Learning Network and receive training on child protection, psychosocial support, INEE standards, inclusion and teaching pedagogy.

title.narrative: UG-0000372 Learn4AgriBusiness-Heifer Uganda

description.narrative: Northern Uganda has one of the highest youth unemployment rates in the world. Particularly for rural youth there is a huge gap between their education and skills levels and market requirements. Edukans and Heifer decided to join forces to close this gap from both ends: by improving access to quality trainings for employable skills, while at the same time creating (self-)employment opportunities in profitable agricultural value chains. This way we will enable 3,200 uneducated young people to earn a decent income to support themselves and their families. To achieve this, we will effectively train them in methods to increase the production of maize, sunflower and groundnuts and to process, store, transport and sell their produce. With these skills they can participate in 2 newly established agri-business hubs that will link them to profitable markets, value chains and support structures.

title.narrative: BO-0000373 Better livelihoods youth - Manq'a

description.narrative: Project description and objectives The ambition is to provide basic gastronomic and social skills training to 3.000 financially marginalized and vulnerable youth. The (self) employment opportunities of at least 70% of Manq’a alumni will be increased through technical and social competencies which align with the demands of the gastronomy market. In total, 2.100 (40 % of total) alumni will have dignified jobs and 900 (30 % of total) will be supported to start an enterprise in the gastronomy or food industry which survives 18 months (this part of the project is funded through BID). Manq’a will start to organize comeback training sessions, e.g. in form of master classes or additional soft skills training. At least 8 out of 10 Manq’a schools are aligned with the (labour) market demands through the application of the Edukans’ 7-STEPS model. Sustainability, both internal and external is key. The business model of Manq’a generates at least 50% of own income, generated through 3 different business models implemented within the project. A number of alumni will be employed within these business models.

title.narrative: PE-0000411 EDU-Q Card Peru

description.narrative: Quality improvement of primary education via participatory assessment on 40 schools in Andes Region, Peru. This project is part of a bigger assessment process in Peru with EDU-Q Card. Another 127 schools will be assessed by request of education bureau in Cusco region. EDU-Q enables further development of School Improvement Plans.

title.narrative: KE-0000392 Training Kenyan Youth - Nairobits

description.narrative:
Goal: Marginalized youth have a decent income to take care of themselves and possible children or younger siblings.
SKILLS - marginalized youth have sufficient skills to become selfemployed: 480 trained marginalized youth, 160 will be trained as IT specialists of which 80 % will be (self)employed within 6 months after finishing training. , 140 will be trained in basic IT skills, who will need additional training to become employed.
QUALITY - improved quality of training and accreditation ensures financial sustainability of Nairobits, allowing to continue supporting marginalized youth: 80 % of students pass assessment after finishing 3 month internship 10% more paying students and 2 new donors by end of 2019 Quality improvement trajectory on quality of internship, accreditation and track and trace finalized: outcome of quality improvement trajectory is positively assessed by Nairobits, Edukans Kenya, graduates and workplace supervisors. 40 workplace supervisors trained on pedagogical and didactical skills Assessment sheets (website development) is developed. Training is accredited Questionnaire developed and used for 25 % of the trained youth

title.narrative: KE-0000393 Training Kenyan - Ujima

description.narrative:
Ujima Foundation provides opportunities to marginalized youth in Kenya by offering them quality vocational education and linking them with the labour market.
Problem: skills learned in TVET institutes did not match the demands from the hospitality industry. Competencies such as communication, conflict management, time management and ownerships is not sufficiently developed with employees which results in a gap in staff competency.
Long term objective: to provide marginalized youth the tools they need for self-support by offering them quality, relevant vocational training.
Ujima becomes self-sustaining through its income generating activities
480 youth trained in hospitality skills Link 480 youth to labour market Improve quality of training by enhancing quality of internships, improving track and trace, Improve sustainability of Ujima by seeking certification

participating-org.ref: Ujima Foundation for Training and Development - UFTD

title.narrative: KE-0000321 Girls@Work

description.narrative: 520 girls will be trained and at least 390 will be (self)employed in 6 months after the training. Income of 390 girls will be about 75% to 100% higher than before the training4.  Siblings/children of the employed girls will be able to go to school (if of school going age)  180 masters from 3 trades are enthused to take in apprentices and able to guide them.  the capacity of 1 organization has increased in order to run 2 different training centers and continue with the WBL and ready steady independently  here will be 1 Kenyan expert to promote WBL and give advice to organizations to start WBL  the financial sustainability of WBL, since it is low cost. Training can be continued for 477 euro per student (based on 240 students per year). Connections have been made with hospitality branch organizations to support the approach. In addition, resources come through income generating activities5 (for orphans and young mothers), scholar fees (other students), and small external donor funding. The option of working on a no-cure no pay bases, where graduates are refunded if they are not employed within 3 months after the end of the training will be examined during the project period.

sector.narrative: Basic life skills for youth and adults

title.narrative: GH-000081 Strength Educ cocoa prod districts

description.narrative:
The Chocolonely Foundation and Edukans are two Dutch organizations aiming to improve the socio-economic situation of underprivileged people (both with their own special mission) in West-Africa. Edukans is a development organization focusing on education and started its educational programme in Ghana with the aim of improving the quality and access to education. Next to the Foundation, the company Tony’s Chocolonely has the goal to produce 100% slave-free chocolate bars with cocoa from Ghana and Ivory Coast. Besides improving the lives of the farmers they are supporting directly through their contract with the ABOCFA cooperative. The Chocolonely Foundation is also seeking for ways to improve the socio-economic circumstances in the communities of the farmers. These communities expressed the importance of, amongst others, improved educational services for their children. This draft proposal is the outcome of various discussions between Tony’s Chocolonely, Edukans and a local expert organizations IBIS and AGREDS.
Results
1. Improved school environment in (at least) 4 schools in Suhum district. a. Renovation of existing school buildings b. Procurement of school desks, and cardboards for teaching and learning material.
2. Improved access to learning materials (especially on cocoa/ professional farming) for pupils in (at least) 4 schools in Suhum district. a. Procurement of relevant teaching and learning materials incl. cocoa curriculum b. Setting up cocoa demonstration plots c. Formation of school clubs for extra-curricular activities, incl cocoa clubs
3. Professional development of teaching capacity for teachers in (at least) 4 schools in Suhum district. a. Teacher training in active learning methodologies b. Teacher training in classroom management
4. Improved efficiency and effectiveness of school management a. Training for head teachers and administrators in effective school management.
5. Improved parent- and community involvement a. Community mobili

participating-org.ref: Assemblies of God Relief en Development Services
participating-org.narrative: Assemblies of God Relief en Development Services

transaction.ref: GH-000081 Strength Educ cocoa prod districts
